summary: This is an email chain from June 30, 2008, discussing a news article about Jeffrey Epstein's plea deal in Florida. The emails congratulate the recipient on the legal outcome and note details of the settlement, including financial damages to victims and Epstein's sentence.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The New York billionaire who pleaded guilty to soliciting prostitution from underage girls in Florida and was sentenced to jail time and house arrest.

persons.name: Deborah Dale Pucillo
persons.context: The judge who sentenced Jeffrey Epstein to 18 months in jail followed by a year of house arrest.

events.title: Epstein's Guilty Plea and Sentencing
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein pleaded guilty to soliciting prostitution from underage girls in South Florida and was sentenced to 18 months in Palm Beach County jail, followed by a year of house arrest, and will be designated a sex offender.

events.title: Epstein's Arrest
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein was arrested two years prior to the 2008 plea deal, with authorities alleging he paid underage girls for sexual massages.

keyFacts: Jeffrey Epstein pleaded guilty to soliciting prostitution from underage girls in Florida on June 30, 2008.
Epstein was sentenced to 18 months in jail followed by a year of house arrest and will be designated a sex offender.
The plea deal required Epstein to pay a minimum of $150,000 in damages to each of 31 girls.
Authorities alleged Epstein paid girls under 18 for naked massages that sometimes became sexual at his Palm Beach home.
Epstein also faced state and federal lawsuits from several women over similar allegations at the time.
